sentences.en: ...the world's largest and most expensive unmanned spacecraft.
sentences.cn: …世界上最大、最贵的无人航天器。

sentences.en: Each of the papers in Science reports data from one of the spacecraft.
sentences.cn: 科学杂志上发表的论文分别报告了来自这些太空船的数据。

sentences.en: Gyroscopes are used in navigational instruments for ships, aircraft, and spacecraft.
sentences.cn: 陀螺仪用于船舶 、 飞机和宇宙飞船中的导航设备.

sentences.en: I paced in the peaceful spacecraft.
sentences.cn: 我在宁静的宇宙飞船里踱步。

sentences.en: If a spacecraft travels faster than 11 km a second, it escapes the earth's gravitational pull.
sentences.cn: 如果飞行速度超过每秒11公里，宇宙飞船将摆脱地球的引力。

sentences.en: Only half of the spacecraft's six science instruments are still in working order.
sentences.cn: 这艘宇宙飞船的6件科学仪器中只有一半还在正常运转。

sentences.en: Scientists are carefully charting the progress of the spacecraft.
sentences.cn: 科学家密切跟踪航天器的运行.
“哥伦比亚”号宇宙飞船昨天着陆。

sentences.en: Spacecraft re - entering the earth's atmosphere are affected by g forces.
sentences.cn: 航天器重返大气层是由于重力的作用.

sentences.en: Spacecraft which are re-entering the earth's atmosphere are affected by g forces.
sentences.cn: 重返大气层的航天器受到重力的作用。

sentences.en: The radio blackout ends as the spacecraft slows down.
sentences.cn: 随着航天飞机减慢速度,无线电通信又重新恢复.

sentences.en: The reflector is held onto the sides of the spacecraft with a frame.
sentences.cn: 反射器通过支架牢牢地固定在航天器的侧面。

sentences.en: The spacecraft burned up when it re - entered the earth's atmosphere.
sentences.cn: 宇宙飞船重新进入地球大气层时烧毁了.

sentences.en: The spacecraft made a successful reentry into the earth's atmosphere.
sentences.cn: 宇宙飞船成功地重返大气层.

sentences.en: The spacecraft slowed and began to re-enter the atmosphere.
sentences.cn: 太空船减慢了速度，开始重返大气层。
两艘太空船成功地会合.

sentences.en: the world's largest and most expensive unmanned spacecraft
sentences.cn: 世界上最大、最贵的无人航天器

sentences.en: There're three astronauts in the spacecraft.
sentences.cn: 在这艘宇宙飞船里有三名宇航员.

phrases.tran_cn: 载人飞船；人操纵的宇宙飞船
无人驾驶飞机；无人宇宙飞船

trans.tran_en: a vehicle that is able to travel in space
